newsitem.title: USA: Missouri wheat harvest near complete, fine yields.
newsitem.headline: Missouri wheat harvest near complete, fine yields.

text.p: Missouri's winter wheat yields continued to be reported well above average as the harvest sped to 92 percent complete as of Sunday, according to the state's Agricultural Statistics Service weekly report.
Wheat harvest was 12 days ahead of the 5-year average. The northeast district was least advanced at 57 percent complete.

Double crop soybeans were 71 percent planted, 8 days behind last year and 4 behind the 5-year average. But 21 percent of all soybeans were blooming, ahead of averages. The crop was rated 60 percent good to excellent, 31 fair.

Corn was 34 percent silked, 3 days behind last year's pace of 44 percent but ahead of the 5-year average. Corn condition statewide was rated 73 percent good to excellent, 24 fair, which was slightly up on last week.
Sorghum rated 59 pct good to excellent, 34 fair, 5 poor.
Cotton rated 34 pct good to excellent, 46 fair, 16 poor.
Topsoil moisture was rated six percent surplus, 64 percent adequate, 26 percent short and 4 percent very short, a moderate decrease from last week.
Pasture conditions remained steady on last week with 57 percent of acreage good to excellent, 33 fair, 9 poor and 1 very poor, the agency said.
